SEARCH
Package edu.gemini.app.ocs

Class OCS

java.lang.Object
edu.gemini.app.ocs.OCS
public class OCS extends Object
This is the main OCS class to be used by other libraries or programs to access the data and functionalities in the Gemini system.

    • executeCommand

      public String executeCommand(String command)
      The following commands are “status” queries used to obtain information about the state of the subsystem.
      • GetVersion The subsystem returns its version identification as a string value.
      • GetStatus The subsystem reports its current status as one of:
        • DOWN - the subsystem is not operational
        • BOOTED - the subsystem has been booted, but not yet configured
        • CONFIGURING - the system is in the process of configuring.
        • CONFIGURED - the subsystem is configured, but not yet initialized
        • INITIALIZING - the subsystem is doing initialization actions
        • RUNNING - the subsystem is running at observing level
        • MAINTENANCE - the subsystem is running at maintenance level
        • SIMULATION - the subsystem is running in simulation mode
        • DISABLED - the subsystem is functional, but has been commanded to ignore control commands
        • SHUTDOWN - the subsystem is in the process of shutting down
        • LOCKED - an interlock exists on this subsystem.
      GetState The internal state of the subsystem is returned as one of:
      • READY - the subsystem is fully operational, but currently idle.
      • BUSY_ON command - the subsystem is working, and currently processing the indicated command.
      • NOT_READY - the subsystem is not responding to commands at this time.
      RunTest The subsystem runs a self-test and reports the result as one of:
      • OK - the subsystem has detected no problems, it is running within specifications
      • BAD - the subsystem has detected problems that prevent its successful operation
      • WARNING - the subsystem has detected a problem that may prevent it from operating to full specification, but does not prevent it from functioning at this time
      Control commands to control the virtual telescope are as followings
      • START - starting the virtual telescope
      • UP - moving the telescope up by 10 points
      • DOWN - moving the telescope down by 10 points
      • LEFT - moving the telescope left by 10 points
      • RIGHT - moving the telescope right by 10 points
      • FOCUS - instructing the telescope to adjust the focus
      • TAKE_PHOTO - taking the photo at the current location
      • STOP - stopping the virtual telescope
      Parameters:
      command - the command to be executed
      Returns:
      the result of running the command

    • createObservingProgram

      public ObservingProgram createObservingProgram(SciencePlan sp, String opticsPrimary, double fStop, double opticsSecondaryRMS, double scienceFoldMirrorDegree, ObservingProgramConfigs.FoldMirrorType scienceFoldMirrorType, int moduleContent, ObservingProgramConfigs.CalibrationUnit calibrationUnit, ObservingProgramConfigs.LightType lightType, TelePositionPair[] telePositionPair)
      Create an observing program
      Parameters:
      sp - The science plan that the observing program is based on
      opticsPrimary - The primary optics that is used in the science plan. There are two types of primary optics:
      • GNZ (GN Zemax Model)
      • GSZ (GS Zemax Model)
      fStop - The f-stop of the primary optics.
      • The value range of f-stop for GNZ is 1.8 - 8.1
      • The value range of f-stop for GSZ is 2.9 - 18.
      opticsSecondaryRMS - The secondary optics that is used in the science plan, which depends on the location of the telescope.
      • South telescope (Cerro Pachón, Chile): 5-13 nm
      • North telescope (Mauna Kea, Hawaii): 5-17 nm
      scienceFoldMirrorDegree - The degree of angle of the fold mirror. The supported degree is in the range of [30, 45].
      scienceFoldMirrorType - The type of the fold mirror. There are two options: Reflective converging beam or Cassegrain focus
      moduleContent - There are 4 types of module content:
      • 1: Module 1 acquisition camera/high resolution wavefront sensor.
      • 2: Module 2: science fold.
      • 3: Module 3: second peripheral wavefront sensor.
      • 4: Module 4: (closest to the sky) first peripheral wavefront sensor.
      calibrationUnit - Calibration Unit (GCAL) Lamp Name. There are 4 options:
      • Argon
      • Xenon
      • ThAr
      • CuAr
      lightType - Light type (for light detector). There are 2 types: Mauna Kea Sky Emission, Cerro Pachon Sky Emission
      telePositionPair - A list of tele position pairs that will be issued to control the movements of the telescope.
      Returns:
      The created observing program

    • saveObservingProgram

      public boolean saveObservingProgram(ObservingProgram op)
      Save the observing program to the OCS system.
      Parameters:
      op - the observing program to be saved.
      Returns:
      true = success, false = failure
